reviews.review_msg: I highly recommend this class to everyone that has room to take the course. Lynn is an absolute gem. She is the sweetest, kindest, most caring, memorable an understanding prof at SFU. You will not regret taking a course with her. The memories I have of this class are all positive.
An absolutely amazing and inspiring woman. She is so loving and caring, and genuinely wants you to enjoy the course and get something out of it.

I am in my fourth year at SFU and all I can say is... THE BEST. This is the best course and teacher that I have come across, it has truly pushed me out of my comfort zone but in a good way.  This lady is the most caring teacher I have met and she will help you in any way she can to ensure you feel comfortable and that you get the best results.

Phenomenal class and prof. Lynn will inspire you and this will become your favourite class. Every education student should take this class as you will get so much out of it. Easily one of the best classes I have ever taken!

Lynn is easily one of the best if not the best prof I have ever had. She cares so much about her students and opens your eyes to so many ideas. Nothing but amazing things to say and so thankful I took this class! I highly recomend it
She is probably my fav teacher ,  caring, always leaving positive comments to the students. Taking her class is a lot of fun ! :ï¼‰

Lynn is super fun and caring. She takes the time to reply and compliment every student, every week. She's encouraging and positive, which really rubs off on the class. This was probably the only class I've ever looked forward to each week. Highly recommended!
Got an A. I guess if i dun skip alot, I will get an A+! nice prof! easiest course @ sfu
Okay class. NOT AS easy as you think
Great teacher~ Fun class~ Always cheering us, providing caring~ I wish I could take another class with her!!

Awesome class! So much fun with weekly activities a chance to see plays and such. Probably the most entertaining upper division course I've ever taken. No exams just weekly mini assignments and a final paper although it's more a free write than a formal academic paper. Lynn is great I wish I could take another class with her again!

Lynn is really nice, fun, and a little crazy in a hippie-type way. There isn't really any homework, or assignments, or exams. All you do is act and do activities all class long. No need to read the text at all. Easiest 4 credits ever!

Claire was an amazing Prof for EDUC 355! The weekly classes are full of theatre games taught by students in class each week. The overall structure focuses on weekly blog style posts on Canvas instead of a research papers, a performance review of a play, and a final group performance. Claire is very kind and approachable, highly recommend!

Claire is a very though professor. She tends to have a very narrow view of activities and how the class should work, which hinders student's creativity. Activities are very tough and she will ask you to hand in your assignment 2 or 3 times. Also, the class barely discusses theatre and it's just games and improv. Not recommended.
